results.title: The Artisan
results.brief_description: A film without narration, following a skilled artisan hand a guitar using traditional woodworking methods, showing all the stages of construction.

results.title: Experience necessary
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
Takes the case of the “speed demon” behind the wheel - the man who wants to see what “she’ll” do. Points out that you need to have experience to handle a car at high speeds. Speed in itself is not dangerous, provided that the road, the traffic, the car and road conditions are right. Above all the driver needs to be careful and experienced and keep in mind at all times that speed can kill.

results.title: B.P. Road Safety
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Take the bus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”
Drinking and driving are a bad combination. Shows examples of things that can happen when the driver has had a “few” at the local hotel. Stresses that it is better to “take the bus” after drinking and so avoid accidents which can happen to the driver, his car and anything that gets in his way.

results.title: Not all pedestrians are people
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
Stresses that not all pedestrians are people! The driver should always give way to pedestrians and that includes people who are careless, children, animals and even the occasional duck! The good driver anticipates what pedestrians and animals may do, especially at night. Advises the rules which both drivers and pedestrians should follow in order to drive safely and avoid accidents.

results.title: Know your car
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
A car is a coach of steel weighing a ton or more, with about a 200 plus horse power engine. The driver should know what this weight and power can do, especially before breaking any of the road rules. Don’t take your car for granted - make sure that brakes are in good condition, that all tyres are in good order, that wheels alignment is right and that all you car lights are working - know your car and stay alive.

results.title: Flying blind
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
The “flying blind” driver is the person who is inattentive and does not seem to be aware that three seconds of “flying blind” can cause accidents. Shows examples of inattentive driving and emphasises that fatigue can cause tragedy. Recommends that a rest stop every two hours or every 100 miles for highway driving is a safety precaution which should not be ignored.

results.title: The Artful dodger
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
There is an artful dodger in every crowd and on every road. Demonstrates the driving style of such a person - the dodging in and out of traffic at high speed which is dangerous and can cause frayed nerves and accidents. The dodger is the person who takes unnecessary risks for no apparent reason - he is not a good safe driver. No other credits available.

results.title: The Art of French cooking
results.creator_credit: Bob Bailey and R&H Media Productions
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of Fernande Garvin’s best selling cookbook. Five famous recipes, using simple ingredients are demonstrated in easy to follow detail. Emphasizes the love and care lavished on ingredients in French cuisine. French toast sandwiches, French onion soup, fish fillets in sauce, beef bourguignon, and cherries jubilee are the featured dishes.

results.title: The Andes
results.brief_description: An account of the Andes mountain range and its effect on the climate, resources and boundaries of a nation. Illustrates the hazardous crossing of the mountains by foot or horse, pointing out that this difficulty is a barrier to commerce between Chile and Argentina. No other credits available.
